questions.text: Direct cash benefit is given under ESI Act for which among the following?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Sickness Benefit- Periodical payment to any insured person in case of his sickness certified by a duly appointed medical practitioner. Maternity Benefit- Periodic payment to an insured woman in case of miscarriage or sickness arising out of pregnency,premature birth of child, certified by an authority specified in this behalf by the regulation. Disablement Benefit- Periodical payment to any insured person suffering from disablement as a result of an employment injury sustained as an employee under the ESI Act,1948 provisions. Dependent’s Benefit- Periodical payment to dependents of insured person who dies as a result of an employment injury sustained as an employee under ESI Act,1948 provisions. Medical Benefit- Medical treatment for and attendance on insured person. Funeral Expenses- Payment towards expenditure on the funeral of the died insured person.
  • • Sickness Benefit- Periodical payment to any insured person in case of his sickness certified by a duly appointed medical practitioner.
  • • Maternity Benefit- Periodic payment to an insured woman in case of miscarriage or sickness arising out of pregnency,premature birth of child, certified by an authority specified in this behalf by the regulation.
  • • Disablement Benefit- Periodical payment to any insured person suffering from disablement as a result of an employment injury sustained as an employee under the ESI Act,1948 provisions.
  • • Dependent’s Benefit- Periodical payment to dependents of insured person who dies as a result of an employment injury sustained as an employee under ESI Act,1948 provisions.
  • • Medical Benefit- Medical treatment for and attendance on insured person.
  • • Funeral Expenses- Payment towards expenditure on the funeral of the died insured person.

questions.text: Screening tests are generally?
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Acceptability Repeatibility/Reliability Validity/Accuracy Others: Simple, Low cost and easy to perform
  • • Acceptability
  • • Repeatibility/Reliability
  • • Validity/Accuracy
  • • Others: Simple, Low cost and easy to perform
  • • Validity has 2 components, sensitivity and specificity. Ideally a screening test should have both high sensitivity and high specificity.

options.text: Factor associated with disease only and is distributed equally in study and control groups

questions.correct_answer: A. Factor associated with both exposure and the disease and is distributed unequally in study and control groups

questions.text: The significance of difference between proportions can be tested by
Paired T test is defined as

options.label: A
options.text: Test used to assess quantitative observations before and after an intervention

options.label: B
options.text: Test that is used when the observations are in the form of proportions ( qualitative data)

options.label: C
options.text: Test applied when separate observations are made on individuals of two separate groups and then needs to be compared

questions.correct_answer: A. Test used to assess quantitative observations before and after an intervention
